Class Letter

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • Letter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener

    public class Letter
extends java.awt.Component
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener
    The Letter class. Creates a letter using JFrame to easily create sentences.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Letter

        public Letter(java.awt.Color colour,
              int sizeX,
              int sizeY,
              boolean idleAnim,
              boolean inAnim,
              boolean outAnim,
              int x,
              int y,
              java.lang.String let,
              int num,
              int size)
        The class constructor. Creates a Letter object with all variables set.
        Parameters:
        colour - The letter's colour.
        size - The letter's size.
        idleAnim - Whether or not the letter animates on screen.
        inAnim - Whether or not the letter animates into the screen.
        outAnim - Whether or not the letter animates out of the screen.
        x - The horizontal position of the letter.
        y - The vertical position of the letter.
        let - The letter to represent.
        num - The index this letter is within the Text class.

    • Method Detail

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws the letter with respective colour and size. Will animate while drawing if animateIn is on. Also calls animateIdle() if animateIdle is on.
        Overrides:
        paint in class java.awt.Component
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics to draw onto.

      • actionPerformed

        The action of the letter while a timer is running. (Animation)
        Specified by:

      • erase

        public void erase()
        Erases the letter. Will animate out if animateOut is on.

        Sends out whether or not the line of text was completed or not

        public void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        Checks when a key is pressed and checks what value was press. If the value matches the letter or any of the special cases then the program continues.
        Specified by:
        keyPressed in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener
